thread.title: Police arrest two as pepper spray, razor used in fight on JetBlue flight
thread.title_full: Police arrest two as pepper spray, razor used in fight on JetBlue flight

author: Ben Mutzabaugh , USA TODAY
title: Police arrest two as pepper spray, razor used in fight on JetBlue flight
text:
JetBlue planes at New York JFK Airport on Nov. 27, 2013. (Photo: Seth Wenig, AP)
Tags JFK Airport Jetblue Airways RW 16 CONNECT 14 TWEET LINKEDIN 6 COMMENT EMAIL MORE It must have been quite a scene as JetBlue Flight 690 arrived to its gate at New York JFK on Wednesday.
A brawl allegedly erupted between two women on the flight, leaving a good Samaritan slashed and others sickened by pepper spray, according to reports from New York City media.
The flight from Kingston, Jamaica, had landed at JFK at around 8:45 a.m. ET and was arriving to the gate when the brouhaha broke out. The New York Post says it began when 61-year-old passenger Jean Ballentine of Brooklyn allegedly tried get from her window seat to the aisle by climbing over 52-year-old Mary Cannady of Linden, N.J.
The New York Daily News says Cannady pushed Ballentine away, but was then punched in the face by the older woman, according to an account of the incident from Port Authority spokesman Joe Pentangelo.
BOOKMARK: Add Today in the Sky to your favorites
USA TODAY
Late for high school reunion, man charged for trying to stop jet on ramp
USA TODAY
Alaska Air, JetBlue take top spots in JD Power airline survey
"A good Samaritan tried to intervene when Ballentine lashed out with an eyebrow razor, cutting the man's elbow," the Daily News adds .
That wasn't all. Newsday of Long Island writes :
"At that point, Cannady got a small can of pepper spray from her pocketbook and squirted the eye-and-skin irritant onto Ballentine, Pentangelo said. … The fight forced the pilot to open the cabin door and order Ballentine escorted off the plane, the spokesman said."
Several passengers were treated for breathing difficulties, Pentangelo tells the Daily News .
JetBlue confirmed the incident to Today in the Sky, saying in a statement:
"On August 26, a customer disagreement occurred shortly after flight 960 arrived at New York’s John F. Kennedy International Airport from Kingston, Jamaica. Law enforcement were called and met the aircraft."
USA TODAY
JetBlue expands service to Cuba
USA TODAY
JetBlue opens outdoor rooftop lounge, with dog walk, at NYC's JFK Airport
The women were arrested and now face a variety of charges, according to The Associated Press. Ballentine's charges include assault and weapons charges, police say. Cannady was arrested for possessing pepper spray, authorities tell AP.
The Post adds "it was unclear how the two women were able to board the plane in Kingston with the bladed instrument and the spray."
JetBlue notes to the newspaper that security screenings in Kingston – where the flight originated – are conducted by the Jamaican Civil Aviation Authority.
TWITTER : You can follow me at twitter.com/TodayInTheSky
JetBlue's 'Vets in Blue’ Airbus A320 is seen at New York’s JFK Airport on Nov. 9, 2014, after arriving from a paint shop facility in Indiana. JetBlue planned to officially unveil the paint scheme a day later on a special charter flight from New York JFK to Washington Reagan National Airport.
